headline: 2030 Alps Games already facing storm of internal controversies and public backlash
description: France received the Olympic flag on Sunday during the closing ceremony of the Milan-Cortina Winter Games. Behind the scenes, however, the handover has been anything but smooth, with multiple crises brewing and public resistance on the rise.

headline: New election rules spice up Paris, Marseille and Lyon mayor races
Top Mexican drug cartel leader killed
Understanding the battle of Verdun through rare or little-known photographs
description: A book published to mark the 110th anniversary of the legendary battle brings to light many images taken by army photographers. Le Monde is presenting several of these photographs, offering a glimpse into the reality behind this symbol of the First World War.

headline: Hong Kong appeals court upholds prison sentences for 12 pro-democracy activists
description: The Hong Kong opposition figures had their appeals dismissed, with their sentences ranging from four years and two months to 10 years, in a ruling that highlights the severity of Beijing's control over Hong Kong's politics.

headline: Park Chan-wook, director of 'No Other Choice,' still believes in the power of collective values
description: The South Korean filmmaker, known for his keen attention to class struggle, brings a sharp social fable to the screen with his adaptation of Donald Westlake's novel 'The Ax,' laced with biting humor.

headline: Donald Trump's support with 'bro culture' is waning
description: With his racist post about the Obamas, support for immigration police and decision to politicize Puerto Rican singer Bad Bunny's halftime Super Bowl show, the US president has alienated some of his supporters.

In Lyon, the far right pays tribute to activist and tries to avoid controversy
description: Around 3,200 people marched peacefully on Saturday afternoon to condemn 'the far left,' one week after Quentin Deranque's death. The local authorities reported Nazi salutes and racist and homophobic slurs to the courts.

headline: Documents show Epstein's attempts at connecting with Sarkozy's circle
description: Nicolas Princen, an adviser to Nicolas Sarkozy at the Elysée Palace, met the sex offender in his Paris apartment in 2011. The meeting, which 'had no follow-up,' according to Princen, illustrates Epstein's attempts to approach the French presidency under Sarkozy.

headline: How a messianic movement is changing the Israeli military
description: Followers of the Hardal movement, a blend of religious fundamentalism and ultranationalism, have begun to make inroads into the military establishment. Their dehumanizing rhetoric toward Palestinians has contributed to the destruction of the Gaza Strip.

headline: Jean Pisani-Ferry: 'German commitment to rearmament is good news and a challenge for Europe'
'What is, ultimately, the point of sending humans into space?'
'In Minneapolis, ICE encountered a political history strong enough to generate a real balance of power'
